Background/Problem: Current edge servers for continuous learning video analytics lack efficient storage systems, creating data management challenges despite growing data demands and privacy concerns.
Method/Approach: Proposes Salient Store framework integrating Computational Storage Devices (CSDs) with FPGAs and SSDs to optimize data compression, encryption, and management tasks.
Result: Salient Store reduces communication latency by ≈6.2× and data volume by ≈6.1× through parallel processing and high internal bandwidth utilization.
Conclusion/Contribution: Demonstrates CSDs can revolutionize storage by making them active computational participants rather than passive repositories in continuous learning systems.
